CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: No phase transition was observed for all three polymers by DSC analysis up to 300 ° C. All polymers have decomposition temperature ( defined as the 5% weight - loss temperature , T d ) over 450 °C under nitrogen as determined by TGA analysis , indicating their excellent thermal stabilities.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Polymers |
| TGA |
| DSC |

Note: TGA and DSC are not materials, but rather techniques used for thermal analysis. They are not considered as "Material Names" in the context of this paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: No phase transition was observed for all three polymers by DSC analysis up to 300 ° C. All polymers have decomposition temperature ( defined as the 5% weight - loss temperature , T d ) over 450 °C under nitrogen as determined by TGA analysis , indicating their excellent thermal stabilities.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 300 °C |
| 450 °C |
| 5% weight-loss temperature |
| T d |

Note:

* 300 °C and 450 °C are temperature values and are presented as Property Values.
* 5% weight-loss temperature and T d are also temperature values, but they are defined in the context of the paragraph as properties of the polymers, hence they are presented as Property Values.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 450 °C |
| 5% weight-loss temperature |

Note:

* 300 °C was removed because it does not clearly refer to a material property.
* T d was removed because it is not a specific value, but rather a variable representing the decomposition temperature.
* 5% weight-loss temperature is a property value, but it is not a specific value, but rather a range.

The valid entities that clearly refer to a material property and have specific values are:

* 450 °C
* 5% weight-loss temperature
